infos.value: I see. These stone chests you claimed from Leonis contain ancient relics...
Yes, in these three chests.
Three of them...you say?
Yes. Three. No doubt about it.
That lackwit Muraga was planning on taking these for himself.
He really is despicable, aye?
You both have my gratitude. It was clearly for the best that I had you keep Muraga under close watch.
Did you hear that, Brother!?
I sure did, aye!
By the way... What has become of Helena?
He...lena...!?
H-Helena!?
Your expressions are answer enough. You've killed her...
Helena's life was essential to bend Sterne to my will.
I assumed that you would realize this, and yet...
I-it's not like that, Lord Sadali! It wasn't us!
Helena and Owe got caught up in Leonis's infighting and lost their lives, aye!
Oh, is that so?
At least, Sterne will be none the wiser if that's the story he's fed, Your Holiness!
And then he would never forgive Oelde for causing this situation, Your Holiness!
I can see that you've thought well in advance about the consequences of your actions.
In deepening his hatred for Oelde, we may be granting Sterne even greater power.
Let us be on our way.
So that I might meet my beloved son Sterne!
Huh? Did he just call Sterne his son?
He's quick to let that fatherly affection spill out, aye?
We're Lord Sadali's personal guards, aren't we?
Aye, we'd be more than a match for that whelp.
What to do, Brother?
What to do, indeed...
Should we kill Sterne, that worm?
We should kill that worm Sterne.
Brother... Things are getting pretty interesting, aren't they?
They sure are. It seems like everyone is in one big mischievous family.
So now what? Do we kill them?
Why is that always your first choice?
Oh, come on! It's the best way to deal with obstacles, isn't it?
If only I could magic away everyone in the world...except for the two of us, of course, Brother.
It seems like more monsters have followed us. You'll have to make due with just them for now.
Whatever you say, Brother!
